title: What Does the 🤮 (Vomit) Emoji Mean? All Your Questions Answered

steps.title: The 🤮 (vomit) emoji is a reaction to something gross or repulsive.
steps.content: The 🤮 (vomit) emoji is a reaction to something gross or repulsive. When used this way, the 🤮 emoji essentially means, “Ugh, that’s nasty!” People may use it when they see something ugly or something that makes them feel annoyed or sick to their stomach. It can be a serious or humorous reaction, depending on the context. [1] X Research source For example: ”Who decorated this office space?! The carpet color alone is an atrocity 🤮.” ”Saw Erik picking his nose in class again 🤢🤮” ”People who are rude and disrespectful to waitstaff make me 🤮.” ”Can you believe this uniform we have to wear?! 🤮 I feel like fashion disaster!"

steps.title: The 🤮 (vomit) emoji can indicate physical illness or feeling nauseous.
steps.content: The 🤮 (vomit) emoji can indicate physical illness or feeling nauseous. The visual says it all! The 🤮 emoji is the perfect choice if you currently have morning sickness, a stomach bug, or any kind of illness that makes you vomit or feel sick to your stomach. [2] X Research source For instance: "Thought the morning sickness stopped after the first trimester? Nope 🤮🤮🤮” "Can you take notes for me in class? Been 🤮 all morning—food poisoning." "Was feeling proud of myself for avoiding a hangover after last night's party—until I stood up and 🤮 everywhere."

steps.title: The 🤮 (vomit) emoji can also mean psychological or emotional discomfort.
steps.content: The 🤮 (vomit) emoji can also mean psychological or emotional discomfort. While this emoji is often used to denote literal illness, you may also see it used in a more figurative sense by someone who’s dealing with something uncomfortable, nerve-wracking, or emotional. For example: ”Just wrapped up my job interview. I’m not sure how it went tbh 🤮.” ”Heading into my algebra exam rn. 🤮 I studied all night but I’m still worried.” ”Ran into my ex at the coffee shop 😳 And he was with his new gf 🤮”

steps.title: Express your disgust in a serious or humorous way.
steps.content: Express your disgust in a serious or humorous way. The 🤮 (vomit) emoji is super versatile! You can use it for pretty much anything that makes you feel grossed out or repulsed, whether you’re being totally serious or humorously dramatic. [3] X Research source ”Just took a bite of old yogurt 🤮 why do I forget to check the expiration date?!” ”Pretty sure I swallowed a bug on my morning walk 🤮 extra protein, right?” ”She showed up wearing the exact same dress as me 🤮 total fiasco.”

steps.title: Let your friends know that you’re sick or hungover.
steps.content: Let your friends know that you’re sick or hungover. Why type out your symptoms when the 🤮 (vomit) emoji can do all the heavy lifting? You don’t necessarily have to be vomiting to use it, though; you can also use it to indicate you're feeling queasy or generally ill. [4] X Research source ”I’m staying home from school. Stomach bug 🤒🤮.” ”Thanks for making me take that last tequila shot. Nonstop 🤮 this morning.” ”I’m never riding a roller coaster again. Ever. 🤢🤮”

steps.title: Show that you’re feeling anxious or emotional about something.
steps.content: Show that you’re feeling anxious or emotional about something. You don’t have to be physically ill to use the 🤮 (vomit) emoji. You can also use it to communicate that you’re feeling nerve-wracked or emotionally rocked by something. [5] X Research source "Cher just texted me for the first time since we broke up 🤮🤮 I’m not ready to talk to her.” ”Trying out for the volleyball team in a few minutes. I’m so nervous 🤮.” ”Did you see Jeremy flirting with her?? Literally no shame 😤🤮”

steps.title: 😷 (unwell) emoji:
steps.content: 😷 (unwell) emoji: Try this emoji if you're sick with something contagious, like a cold or the flu. "Staying home today 😷 I don't want to give anyone else this bug!"

steps.title: 🤢 (nauseated) emoji:
steps.content: 🤢 (nauseated) emoji: Go with this emoji if you're feeling queasy but you're not quite ready to 🤮 yet. "I shouldn't have had that extra serving of mashed potatoes at lunch 🤢"

steps.title: 🤒 (sick with fever) emoji:
steps.content: 🤒 (sick with fever) emoji: If you're ill and have a fever (but you aren't throwing up), you could use this emoji instead. "Ugh, I can't hang out today 🤒 I'm pretty sure I have the flu."

steps.title: 🥴 (woozy) emoji:
steps.content: 🥴 (woozy) emoji: This is a good one if you're feeling dizzy or queasy, especially after drinking alcohol. "Come out to the party tonight, Cara! It's gonna be a blast 🎉 🍺 🥴"

steps.title: Pair a few emojis together to say something even more specific.
steps.content: Pair a few emojis together to say something even more specific. You can easily tell a story without words with a few creative emoji pairings! Feel free to invent your own combinations, but here are a few ideas to get you started: 🎢 🤢 🤮 : Try this combo if you're feeling rocked by something either emotionally or literally. 🍺 😵 🤮 : After a night of drinking, you might text your friend this string of emojis rather than type it all out. They'll get the idea! 🤢 🤮 🛏 : Use this pairing to communicate that you're staying home because you're sick or hungover and plan to stay in bed all day.
